a:r.a:t: Executive Summary
Situation Overview
Favorable Market Dynamics
It is an opportune time for Lucas to consider a potential sale – (i) robust trading multiples and M&A activity, (ii) favorable debt markets and (iii) strong company market position and momentum

Despite strong deal volume, there remains a shortage of high quality targets – healthy demand for established targets such as Lucas is resulting in “scarcity premium” from both strategic and financial buyers
Lincoln has long-standing relationships with, and access to, the best strategic buyers for Lucas – extensive insights into buyer “behaviors,” including when and how best to approach them
Orchard Holdings Group, LLC (“Orchard”), acquired Lucas Group (“Lucas” or the “Company”) in September 2013 from H.I.G. Capital

Since acquisition, Orchard has worked closely with Lucas' management team to establish the Company as the nation’s largest mid-management permanent placement firm targeting small-to-medium sized businesses (“SMBs”)
Through the implementation of various strategic initiatives, Lucas has significantly improved its business model leading to:
Highly diversified revenue streams and customer base
Geographic expansion
Industry-low recruiter turnover
Continued strong organic growth with significant free cash flow
Orchard would like to explore a control sale of Lucas based on strong momentum in the business, a favorable M&A market and the potential to return significant capital to the family office
As Lucas' advisor, our role is to listen, create options and pursue the path that best achieves the shareholders’ collective objectives

Enthusiastically convey the Lucas “story” – focus buyers on the market leadership position, articulate the extensive initiatives Lucas has taken to reduce its downside risk and creatively position the Company to obtain credit for pro forma adjustments associate with geographic expansion

Creating a highly competitive, disciplined sale processes that leverages acquirers’ excitement surrounding the business and Lincoln’s full suite of global capabilities will maximize valuation at the optimal terms for Lucas and Orchard
Lincoln believes that Lucas can achieve
a valuation of 7x – 8x 2017E EBITDA
($72 million – $83 million)
